intro: Geigeria burkei var. zeyheri, commonly known as the Zeyher's geigeria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and small, yellowish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts well to dry and warm climates. Its foliage is often aromatic, and it is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
